channel.title: Post links to free samples here!
channel.description:
Post your .wav samples here so others can use them!
___
Mod edit:
**Related topics:** [Importing Samples FAQ](http://auxy.co/importfaq.html) [Thread about importing samples eg: from a PC](https://disco.auxy.co/t/how-do-you-import-samples/6687) [Open sounds from other IOS apps in Auxy](https://disco.auxy.co/t/open-sounds-from-other-ios-apps-in-auxy-5/6626) [Sample Importing ideas](https://disco.auxy.co/t/sample-importing-ideas/6680) [Post your OWN ORIGINAL sample packs here](https://disco.auxy.co/t/post-your-own-original-sample-packs-here/6890/2)

item.title: Post links to free samples here!
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
The 7th pack was sourced from PureMagnetik, yes. Packs 1 and 5 were sourced through SampleTek (although 1 was supposedly from N. Flytt, but that got removed in Auxy 5), boom bass (technically pack 8) was the only melodic pack from blackoctopus. Unless it wasnâ€™t explicitly labeled on the app, I donâ€™t think any were from Cymatics however.

Read full topic

item.description:
Cymatics.fm

Cymatics.fm - The #1 Site For Serum Presets, Samplepacks & More!

The #1 site for Serum presets, Samplepacks, & more. Find your sound, and take your music production to the next level today!

Cymatics is where itâ€™s at. Theyâ€™ve got amazing free drum/vocal/melodic loops and samples, for many different genres. Most are free with an account, though some cost money.

item.title: Post links to free samples here!
item.dc:creator: lemonboy
item.description:
spoiler

I usually go to this website all the time, I think? And itâ€™s THE best free samples website I found in my entire life. Itâ€™s where the dream is. -> https://soundpacks.com/

  • Find a pack of your choice & check it out

  • Click download (nothing is allowed. Only a single tap)

  • When the pack is downloaded, press the zip folder on files

  • Enjoy your new samples!

You should go there, I swear. For noobies or people who donâ€™t have imported samples, then go to the link in the post, thx. [EDIT: forgot to say this: If you donâ€™t have the subscription, then your not lucky. If you need to get em, youâ€™ll need to buy the premium subscription because it allows importing samples. Thx & Iâ€™ll see you soon!

Read full topic

item.title: Post links to free samples here!
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
LANDR just released a free sample pack from softcoresoft.

https://samples.landr.com/samples/packs/from_my_house_to_the_warehouse/

From Montreal-based DJ and producer softcoresoft comes a collection of acid-soaked basslines and hypnotic minimal percussion. Get squelchy analog basses and rave-ready kicks doused in late-night ambience and speaker pumping crunch.

Check out the rest of the free packs at: samples.landr.com

https://twitter.com/softcoresoft
https://soundcloud.com/softcoresoft

Read full topic
item.source: Post links to free samples here!

item.title: Post links to free samples here!
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Not sure why I didnâ€™t look into this sooner, but the app Documents by Readdle will allow you to download audio to your device via a built in web browser with download functionality. Was just testing it on my phone, itâ€™s really going to be about a thousand times better on the iPad but the good news is it looks totally free and seems to work pretty well (as a test I grabbed a break beat from Phatsoâ€™s Drum palace or whatever, worked just fine). Youâ€™ll still need something to convert to appropriate format in some cases but hey, at least you donâ€™t need a computer to do all this stuff.

Now the million dollar question - AudioShare USED to have a web browser built in for this same purpose, but Apple made the dev remove it. Why does Readdle get a pass?

Read full topic

SHAKE | Loops & Samples Of Things You Shake

SHAKE LOOPS & SAMPLES OF THINGS YOU SHAKE SHAKE is a collection of loops and samples of shakers and tambourines. Add some groove and swing to your productions. SHAKE is also available as part of the FREE  and EVRYTHNG  bundles.

ELPHNT // Make Better Music with Ableton Live

707 | The Sound Of A Classic Drum Machine

707 GET THE SOUND OF A CLASSIC DRUM MACHINE 707 is a faithful recreation of the classic Roland TR-707 drum machine used by artists such as Aphex Twin, Daft Punk, Plastikman and more. The Ableton Drum Rack takes it one step further by presenting...

Price: USD 0.00

https://www.youtube.com/embed/SDqaJROopho
